author: Maria Armental
title: Clorox to Open Board Nominations to Certain Shareholders
text:
Clorox Co. has adopted a so-called proxy-access policy allowing certain shareholders to nominate members to its board, the company said Friday.
The Securities and Exchange Commission brought the issue to the forefront in 2010, adopting a rule that required companies to list shareholder nominees on corporate proxy ballots, rather than mailing separate ballots and waging a potentially costly campaign.
